user_input: What law applies for issues such as court intervention in an arbitration, and why is it important to choose a country that is a signatory to the New York Convention?
reference: The procedural law of the seat of the arbitration typically applies for issues such as court intervention. It is important to choose a country that is a signatory to the New York Convention because this ensures the enforceability of the award, making it easier to resolve disputes through international legal mechanisms.

WHEREAS: 
(A) The Government has set ambitious targets in the Relevant Jurisdiction for the deployment of new 
solar power generation capacity at affordable prices; 
(B) To promote its policy of increased generation and supply of electricity at affordable prices, the 
Government wishes to provide certain assistance and support to the Project Company who wishes 
to develop, own, operate and maintain the Facility; 
(C) Consequently, the Government wishes to enter into an Implementation Agreement with the Project 
Company and to procure that the Project Company enters into a Power Purchase Agreement with 
the Buyer for the sale and purchase of all electricity generated by the Facility; 
(D) To carry out the Project, the Project Company wishes to enter into: 
(a) a Supply Agreement with the Supplier in relation to the engineering, design, procurement,']
reference: The key terms and conditions for using Open Solar Contracts v2.0, as outlined in the Terms of Use and Disclaimer available at https://opensolarcontracts.org/Terms, include the Creative Commons Attribution-ShareAlike 3.0 IGO license under which the work is made available. By using this work, parties agree to be bound by these terms, which may be amended from time to time. Additionally, specific clauses such as Sectional Completion (4.1) and Technical Dispute Determination (22.4) are detailed in the contract, providing guidelines for the purchase of energy output and resolution of disputes between the Buyer and Project Company.
